titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:10-0400

did.abstract: Southern Tepehuan songs and stories originally recorded on wire by John Alden Mason in Xoconostle and Durango, Mexico in Februrary 1948, with consultants Ger贸nimo Aguilar and Pedro Aguilar. Music includes mitote songs and some traditional and popular songs. Stories include autobiographical stories and numerous unidentified texts. Mason's trip to the Tepehuan Indians in Mexico was sponsored in part by the American Philosophical Society and the University Museum of the University of Pennsylvania.
did.physdesc: 4 sound tape reels (1 hr., 10 min.) : analog, 7 1/2 ips, full track, mono ; 7 in.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Recording contains some irregularity in speed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Collector documentation, transcriptions, translations, and other related materials are available in the John Alden Mason papers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift from John Alden Mason in 1952.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Wire recording) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
